meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unchaste.
meanings.sent1: Her unchastity was evident to everyone in the village.
meanings.sent2: The nun took a vow of unchastity to dedicate her life to serving others.
meanings.sent3: The unchastity of the gossiping parrot scandalized the other birds.
meanings.sent4: The unchastity of the polluted river was a stark reminder of human neglect.
meanings.sent5: The unchastity of the graffiti on the church wall was a desecration of sacred space.

meanings.definition: Lack of sexual purity or virtue.
meanings.sent1: The unchastity of the scandalous affair shocked the small town.
meanings.sent2: In the Puritan society, any hint of unchastity was met with severe punishment.
meanings.sent3: The unchastity of the mischievous cat chasing after every neighborhood feline was a source of amusement.
meanings.sent4: The unchastity of the stormy ocean waves crashing against the shore was a powerful display of nature's wild side.
meanings.sent5: The unchastity of the forbidden fruit tempted Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden.
